intro: Phyllactis lapathifolia, commonly known as the lesser cow-wheat, is a herbaceous plant belonging to the family Primulaceae. It is characterized by its basal rosette of lanceolate, hairy leaves and produces small, yellowish-green flowers clustered in umbels. The plant is typically found in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and meadows. It has a creeping rhizome that allows it to spread vegetatively. Phyllactis lapathifolia is often associated with calcareous soils and is considered a characteristic species of certain European habitats.
